description: The underlying cause of the issue described in CVE-2023-5472 is a use after free vulnerability present in the Chromium open source software. This flaw occurs when the software deallocates memory that is still in use, leading to potential data corruption or arbitrary code execution. The vulnerability affects the profiles component of Chromium, which is integrated into the Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) browser. The specific build numbers associated with the solution are 118.0.2088.76 for Microsoft Edge and 118.0.5993.117 for Windows 10. These versions address the vulnerability, ensuring that users are no longer susceptible to the issues initially presented by this flaw. Refer to KB-118.0.2088.76 for further details regarding the security updates.
